content.en: To think is to not be enough. To think is to have a hole in the head.
content.cn: 思考即是匮乏。思考即是在头颅上凿开一个洞。
content.tw: 思考即是匱乏。思考即是在頭顱上鑿開一個洞。

source: Land, Nick. Fanged Noumena: Collected Writings 1987–2007. Falmouth: Urbanomic, 2011.

content.en: Thinking has interests that do not coincide with those of living.
content.cn: 思维的利益并不与生存的利益重合。
content.tw: 思維的利益並不與生存的利益重合。

source: Brassier, Ray. Nihil Unbound: Enlightenment and Extinction. London: Palgrave Macmillan, 2007.

content.en: The apparatus is a black box that simulates thought in order to dispense with it.
content.cn: 装置是一个黑箱，它模拟思想，旨在免除思想。
content.tw: 裝置是一個黑箱，它模擬思想，旨在免除思想。

source: Flusser, Vilém. Towards a Philosophy of Photography. London: Reaktion Books, 2000.

content.en: We are not in front of the image, we are within the image.
content.cn: 我们不在图像面前，我们在图像之中。
content.tw: 我們不在圖像面前，我們在圖像之中。

source: Groys, Boris. In the Flow. London: Verso, 2016.

content.en: The corpse is the only completely proficient art object.
content.cn: 尸体是唯一完全精通的艺术客体。
content.tw: 屍體是唯一完全精通的藝術客體。

source: Ligotti, Thomas. The Conspiracy against the Human Race. New York: Hippocampus Press, 2010.

content.en: Every photograph is a certificate of presence.
content.cn: 每一张照片都是在场的证明书。
content.tw: 每一張照片都是在場的證明書。

source: Barthes, Roland. Camera Lucida: Reflections on Photography. New York: Hill and Wang, 1981.

content.en: Death is the movement of non-being in being.
content.cn: 死亡是非存在于存在之中的运动。
content.tw: 死亡是非存在於存在之中的運動。

source: Blanchot, Maurice. The Space of Literature. Lincoln: University of Nebraska Press, 1982.

content.en: We live in a world where there is more and more information, and less and less meaning.
content.cn: 我们生活在一个信息越来越多，而意义越来越少的世界。
content.tw: 我們生活在一個信息越來越多，而意義越來越少的世界。

source: Baudrillard, Jean. Simulacra and Simulation. Ann Arbor: University of Michigan Press, 1994.

content.en: The catastrophe is not what comes; the catastrophe is what is here.
content.cn: 灾难并非即将到来之物；灾难即是此地之物。
content.tw: 災難並非即將到來之物；災難即是此地之物。

source: Stengers, Isabelle. In Catastrophic Times: Resisting the Coming Barbarism. Lüneburg: Open Humanities Press, 2015.

content.en: Beauty is nothing but the beginning of terror.
content.cn: 美无非是恐怖的开端。
content.tw: 美無非是恐怖的開端。

source: Rilke, Rainer Maria. Duino Elegies. New York: W. W. Norton & Company, 2009.

content.en: The real is what resists symbolization.
content.cn: 实在界即是那抵抗符号化之物。
content.tw: 實在界即是那抵抗符號化之物。

source: Lacan, Jacques. The Four Fundamental Concepts of Psychoanalysis. New York: W. W. Norton & Company, 1981.

content.en: Humanity is a thin layer of bacteria on a ball of mud hurling through the void.
content.cn: 人类不过是飞驰于虚空中的泥球上一层薄薄的细菌。
content.tw: 人類不過是飛馳於虛空中的泥球上一層薄薄的細菌。

source: Gray, John. Straw Dogs: Thoughts on Humans and Other Animals. London: Granta Books, 2002.

content.en: We are all serving a life sentence in the dungeon of the self.
content.cn: 我们都在自我的地牢里服无期徒刑。
content.tw: 我們都在自我的地牢裡服無期徒刑。

source: Cioran, Emil. The Trouble with Being Born. New York: Arcade Publishing, 2012.

content.en: To write is to organize life around a wound.
content.cn: 写作即是围绕伤口组织生命。
content.tw: 寫作即是圍繞傷口組織生命。

source: Bousquet, Joë. Translated within Deleuze, Gilles. The Logic of Sense. New York: Columbia University Press, 1990.

content.en: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
content.cn: 应对不自由世界的唯一方式，是变得绝对自由，以至于你的存在本身即是一种反叛。
content.tw: 應對不自由世界的唯一方式，是變得絕對自由，以至於你的存在本身即是一種反叛。

source: Camus, Albert. The Rebel. New York: Vintage International, 1991.

content.en: Silence is not the absence of sound, but the beginning of listening.
content.cn: 沉默并非声音的缺席，而是倾听的开始。
content.tw: 沉默並非聲音的缺席，而是傾聽的開始。

source: Nancy, Jean-Luc. Listening. New York: Fordham University Press, 2007.

content.en: A machine is a machine only when it is cut off from the world.
content.cn: 机器只有在与世界隔绝时，才成为机器。
content.tw: 機器只有在與世界隔絕時，才成為機器。

source: Simondon, Gilbert. On the Mode of Existence of Technical Objects. Minneapolis: Univocal Publishing, 2017.

content.en: The future is dead, but the past is not yet over.
content.cn: 未来已死，但过去尚未终结。
content.tw: 未來已死，但過去尚未終結。

source: Fisher, Mark. Ghosts of My Life: Writings on Depression, Hauntology and Lost Futures. Winchester: Zero Books, 2014.

content.en: We do not know what a body can do.
content.cn: 我们不知道一个身体能做什么。
content.tw: 我們不知道一個身體能做什麼。

source: Spinoza, Baruch. Ethics. London: Penguin Classics, 1996.

content.en: The mirror is the only way for the eye to see itself, which is to say, to die.
content.cn: 镜子是眼睛看见自身的唯一方式，换言之，即死亡。
content.tw: 鏡子是眼睛看見自身的唯一方式，換言之，即死亡。

source: Baudrillard, Jean. Seduction. Montreal: New World Perspectives, 1990.

content.en: Only the improbable is real; the probable is merely potential.
content.cn: 唯有不可思议者为真；那可能的不过是潜势。
content.tw: 唯有不可思議者為真；那可能的不過是潛勢。

source: Flusser, Vilém. Into the Universe of Technical Images. Minneapolis: University of Minnesota Press, 2011.

content.en: Recursion is not repetition, but a looping movement that generates its own ground.
content.cn: 递归并非重复，而是一种生成自身根基的循环运动。
content.tw: 遞歸並非重複，而是一種生成自身根基的循環運動。

source: Hui, Yuk. Recursion and Contingency. London: Rowman & Littlefield, 2019.

content.en: Every technology is a technology of memory, and thus a technology of death.
content.cn: 每一种技术都是记忆的技术，因此也是死亡的技术。
content.tw: 每一種技術都是記憶的技術，因此也是死亡的技術。

source: Stiegler, Bernard. Technics and Time, 2: Disorientation. Stanford: Stanford University Press, 2008.

content.en: The desert grows. Woe to him who hides deserts within.
content.cn: 荒漠在生长。祸哉，那心中藏着荒漠的人。
content.tw: 荒漠在生長。禍哉，那心中藏著荒漠的人。

source: Nietzsche, Friedrich. Thus Spoke Zarathustra. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2006.

content.en: All things are full of gods.
content.cn: 万物皆充满神性。
content.tw: 萬物皆充滿神性。

source: Thales (Cited in Aristotle, De Anima). Rethought in Bennett, Jane. Vibrant Matter: A Political Ecology of Things. Durham: Duke University Press, 2010.

content.en: The screen is the shield that protects us from the real.
content.cn: 屏幕是保护我们免受真实伤害的盾牌。
content.tw: 屏幕是保護我們免受真實傷害的盾牌。

source: Žižek, Slavoj. Welcome to the Desert of the Real. London: Verso, 2002.

content.en: Information is the disintegration of the spirit.
content.cn: 信息即精神的瓦解。
content.tw: 信息即精神的瓦解。

source: Han, Byung-Chul. In the Swarm: Digital Prospects. Cambridge: MIT Press, 2017.

content.en: To map a territory is to possess it, but to glitch a map is to free it.
content.cn: 绘制疆域图即是占有，而使地图故障则是解放。
content.tw: 繪製疆域圖即是佔有，而使地圖故障則是解放。

source: Russell, Legacy. Glitch Feminism: A Manifesto. London: Verso, 2020.

content.en: The end of the world is already here; it’s just unevenly distributed.
content.cn: 世界末日已然降临，只是分布不均。
content.tw: 世界末日已然降臨，只是分佈不均。

source: Morton, Timothy. Hyperobjects: Philosophy and Ecology after the End of the World. Minneapolis: University of Minnesota Press, 2013.

content.en: A labyrinth is a structure compounded to confuse men; its architecture, rich in symmetries, is subordinated to that end.
content.cn: 迷宫是一种为了以此困惑人类而建构的结构；其富于对称的建筑学，皆臣服于此目的。
content.tw: 迷宮是一種為了以此困惑人類而建構的結構；其富於對稱的建築學，皆臣服於此目的。

source: Borges, Jorge Luis. Labyrinths. New York: New Directions, 1962.

content.en: Action is not a reaction, but a creation.
content.cn: 行动并非反应，而是创造。
content.tw: 行動並非反應，而是創造。

source: Deleuze, Gilles. Cinema 1: The Movement-Image. Minneapolis: University of Minnesota Press, 1986.

content.en: There is no such thing as a digital copy; everything is an original performance.
content.cn: 不存在所谓的数字副本；一切皆是原创的展演。
content.tw: 不存在所謂的數字副本；一切皆是原創的展演。

source: Steyerl, Hito. The Wretched of the Screen. Berlin: Sternberg Press, 2012.

content.en: The planetary is not the global. The global is a flattening; the planetary is a deepening.
content.cn: 行星性并非全球性。全球性是扁平化，行星性是深化。
content.tw: 行星性並非全球性。全球性是扁平化，行星性是深化。

source: Spivak, Gayatri Chakravorty. Death of a Discipline. New York: Columbia University Press, 2003.

content.en: The horror of philosophy is the horror of a world without us.
content.cn: 哲学的恐怖，即是一个没有我们的世界的恐怖。
content.tw: 哲學的恐怖，即是一個沒有我們的世界的恐怖。

source: Thacker, Eugene. In the Dust of This Planet. Winchester: Zero Books, 2011.

content.en: Hell is other people.
content.cn: 他人即地狱。
content.tw: 他人即地獄。

source: Sartre, Jean-Paul. No Exit and Three Other Plays. New York: Vintage, 1989.

content.en: We are nothing but the sum of our scars.
content.cn: 我们无非是自身伤痕的总和。
content.tw: 我們無非是自身傷痕的總和。

source: Mishima, Yukio. Confessions of a Mask. New York: New Directions, 1958.

content.en: The only way to support the system is to introduce a virus.
content.cn: 支撑系统的唯一方式是引入病毒。
content.tw: 支撐系統的唯一方式是引入病毒。

source: Baudrillard, Jean. Screened Out. London: Verso, 2002.

content.en: Every image is a sleep.
content.cn: 每一幅图像都是一场睡眠。
content.tw: 每一幅圖像都是一場睡眠。

source: Nancy, Jean-Luc. The Ground of the Image. New York: Fordham University Press, 2005.

content.en: The archive is not a repository of the past, but a machine for the future.
content.cn: 档案并非过去的仓库，而是通向未来的机器。
content.tw: 檔案並非過去的倉庫，而是通向未來的機器。

source: Derrida, Jacques. Archive Fever: A Freudian Impression. Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1996.

content.en: We must become the pitiless censors of ourselves.
content.cn: 我们必须成为自身无情的审查者。
content.tw: 我們必須成為自身無情的審查者。

source: Nietzsche, Friedrich. The Will to Power. New York: Vintage, 1968.

content.en: Language is a skin: I rub my language against the other.
content.cn: 语言是一层皮肤：我用我的语言摩擦他人。
content.tw: 語言是一層皮膚：我用我的語言摩擦他人。

source: Barthes, Roland. A Lover's Discourse: Fragments. New York: Hill and Wang, 1978.

content.en: There is no reality, only interpretations.
content.cn: 没有事实，只有阐释。
content.tw: 沒有事實，只有闡釋。

source: Nietzsche, Friedrich. The Portable Nietzsche. New York: Penguin, 1976.

content.en: The eye is a cannibal.
content.cn: 眼睛是个食人族。
content.tw: 眼睛是個食人族。

source: Bataille, Georges. Story of the Eye. San Francisco: City Lights Books, 1987.

content.en: To destroy is to create.
content.cn: 毁灭即创造。
content.tw: 毀滅即創造。

source: Bakunin, Mikhail. God and the State. New York: Dover Publications, 1970.

content.en: The abyss is the only mirror that does not lie.
content.cn: 深渊是唯一不说谎的镜子。
content.tw: 深淵是唯一不說謊的鏡子。

source: Pessoa, Fernando. The Book of Disquiet. London: Penguin Classics, 2002.

content.en: Architecture is the fossilized will of power.
content.cn: 建筑是权力意志的化石。
content.tw: 建築是權力意志的化石。

source: Virilio, Paul. Bunker Archeology. New York: Princeton Architectural Press, 1994.

content.en: We are the tools of our tools.
content.cn: 我们是我们工具的工具。
content.tw: 我們是我們工具的工具。

source: Thoreau, Henry David. Walden. Princeton: Princeton University Press, 2004.

content.en: The medium is the message.
content.cn: 媒介即讯息。
content.tw: 媒介即訊息。

source: McLuhan, Marshall. Understanding Media: The Extensions of Man. New York: McGraw-Hill, 1964.

content.en: The post-human is not the end of the human, but the deconstruction of the human.
content.cn: 后人类并非人类的终结，而是人类的解构。
content.tw: 後人類並非人類的終結，而是人類的解構。

source: Hayles, N. Katherine. How We Became Posthuman. Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1999.

content.en: Chaos is not a mess, but a different kind of order.
content.cn: 混沌并非混乱，而是另一种秩序。
content.tw: 混沌並非混亂，而是另一種秩序。

source: Deleuze, Gilles, and Félix Guattari. What Is Philosophy? New York: Columbia University Press, 1994.

content.en: To define is to kill.
content.cn: 定义即扼杀。
content.tw: 定義即扼殺。

source: Wilde, Oscar. The Picture of Dorian Gray. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2006.

content.en: The artificial is the new natural.
content.cn: 人造即新的自然。
content.tw: 人造即新的自然。

source: Bratton, Benjamin H. The Stack: On Software and Sovereignty. Cambridge: MIT Press, 2016.

content.en: We are trapped in the prison of our own consciousness.
content.cn: 我们被困在自身意识的监狱中。
content.tw: 我們被困在自身意識的監獄中。

source: Metzinger, Thomas. The Ego Tunnel. New York: Basic Books, 2009.

content.en: The glitch is a rupture in the flow of information.
content.cn: 故障是信息流中的断裂。
content.tw: 故障是信息流中的斷裂。

source: Cuboniks, Laboria. Xenofeminism: A Politics for Alienation. London: Verso, 2018.

content.en: Matter is not inert; it is vibrant and alive.
content.cn: 物质并非惰性的；它是震颤且鲜活的。
content.tw: 物質並非惰性的；它是震顫且鮮活的。

source: Bennett, Jane. Vibrant Matter. Durham: Duke University Press, 2010.

content.en: History is a nightmare from which I am trying to awake.
content.cn: 历史是一场我试图从中醒来的噩梦。
content.tw: 歷史是一場我試圖從中醒來的噩夢。

source: Joyce, James. Ulysses. London: Bodley Head, 1960.

content.en: The only way to find yourself is to lose yourself.
content.cn: 找回自己的唯一方式是迷失自己。
content.tw: 找回自己的唯一方式是迷失自己。

source: Deleuze, Gilles. Difference and Repetition. New York: Columbia University Press, 1994.

content.en: Everything that is solid melts into air.
content.cn: 一切坚固的东西都烟消云散了。
content.tw: 一切堅固的東西都煙消雲散了。

source: Marx, Karl. The Communist Manifesto. London: Penguin, 2002.

content.en: The shadow is as important as the light.
content.cn: 阴影与光芒同等重要。
content.tw: 陰影與光芒同等重要。

source: Tanizaki, Jun'ichirō. In Praise of Shadows. New Haven: Leete's Island Books, 1977.

content.en: The map precedes the territory.
content.cn: 地图先行于疆域。
content.tw: 地圖先行於疆域。

source: Baudrillard, Jean. Simulacra and Simulation. Ann Arbor: University of Michigan Press, 1994.

content.en: We are all cyborgs now.
content.cn: 我们现在都是赛博格。
content.tw: 我們現在都是賽博格。

source: Haraway, Donna. Simians, Cyborgs, and Women: The Reinvention of Nature. New York: Routledge, 1991.

content.en: The gaze is the object that looks back.
content.cn: 凝视是那个回望的客体。
content.tw: 凝視是那個回望的客體。

source: Lacan, Jacques. The Four Fundamental Concepts of Psychoanalysis. New York: W. W. Norton & Company, 1981.

content.en: Memory is a poet, not a historian.
content.cn: 记忆是诗人，而非史学家。
content.tw: 記憶是詩人，而非史學家。

source: Sontag, Susan. Regarding the Pain of Others. New York: Farrar, Straus and Giroux, 2003.

content.en: The text is a tissue of quotations.
content.cn: 文本是引语的织物。
content.tw: 文本是引語的織物。

source: Barthes, Roland. Image-Music-Text. New York: Hill and Wang, 1977.

content.en: I am not what I am, I am what I do with my hands.
content.cn: 我不是我所是，我是我手所作。
content.tw: 我不是我所是，我是我手所作。

source: Bourgeois, Louise. Louise Bourgeois: Destruction of the Father / Reconstruction of the Father. London: Violette Editions, 1998.

content.en: The void is not nothingness, but a plenitude.
content.cn: 虚空并非无物，而是一种充盈。
content.tw: 虛空並非無物，而是一種充盈。

source: Badiou, Alain. Being and Event. London: Continuum, 2005.

content.en: Time is the substance I am made of.
content.cn: 时间是构成我的物质。
content.tw: 時間是構成我的物質。

source: Borges, Jorge Luis. Labyrinths. New York: New Directions, 1962.

content.en: The ultimate truth is that there is no ultimate truth.
content.cn: 终极真理即是不存在终极真理。
content.tw: 終極真理即是不存在終極真理。

source: Derrida, Jacques. Of Grammatology. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press, 1976.

content.en: Every act of creation is an act of destruction.
content.cn: 每一次创造皆是一次毁灭。
content.tw: 每一次創造皆是一次毀滅。

source: Picasso, Pablo. Cited in Gilot, Françoise. Life with Picasso. New York: McGraw-Hill, 1964.

content.en: The wound is the place where the light enters you.
content.cn: 伤口是光进入你身体的地方。
content.tw: 傷口是光進入你身體的地方。

source: Rumi. The Essential Rumi. San Francisco: Harper, 1995.

content.en: We are the hollow men.
content.cn: 我们是空心人。
content.tw: 我們是空心人。

source: Eliot, T. S. The Waste Land and Other Poems. New York: Harcourt, Brace and Company, 1934.

content.en: Existence precedes essence.
content.cn: 存在先于本质。
content.tw: 存在先於本質。

source: Sartre, Jean-Paul. Existentialism Is a Humanism. New Haven: Yale University Press, 2007.

content.en: The body is a prison for the soul.
content.cn: 身体是灵魂的牢笼。
content.tw: 身體是靈魂的牢籠。

source: Plato. Phaedo. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2009.

content.en: The spectacle is not a collection of images, but a social relation among people, mediated by images.
content.cn: 景观并非图像的集合，而是由图像中介的人与人之间的社会关系。
content.tw: 景觀並非圖像的集合，而是由圖像中介的人與人之間的社會關係。

source: Debord, Guy. The Society of the Spectacle. New York: Zone Books, 1994.

content.en: To be is to be perceived.
content.cn: 存在即被感知。
content.tw: 存在即被感知。

source: Berkeley, George. A Treatise Concerning the Principles of Human Knowledge. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1998.

content.en: The limit of my language is the limit of my world.
content.cn: 我语言的界限即我世界的界限。
content.tw: 我語言的界限即我世界的界限。

source: Wittgenstein, Ludwig. Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus. London: Routledge, 1922.

content.en: There is no innocent eye.
content.cn: 不存在无辜的眼睛。
content.tw: 不存在無辜的眼睛。

source: Gombrich, E. H. Art and Illusion. Princeton: Princeton University Press, 1960.

content.en: The image is a pure creation of the mind.
content.cn: 图像是心灵的纯粹创造。
content.tw: 圖像是心靈的純粹創造。

source: Bachelard, Gaston. The Poetics of Space. Boston: Beacon Press, 1994.

content.en: The visible is a trap.
content.cn: 可见者是陷阱。
content.tw: 可見者是陷阱。

source: Foucault, Michel. Discipline and Punish. New York: Vintage, 1995.

content.en: We are shadows of shadows.
content.cn: 我们是影子的影子。
content.tw: 我們是影子的影子。

source: Plato. The Republic. New York: Basic Books, 1991.

content.en: The future is a foreign country; they do things differently there.
content.cn: 未来是个异国；那里行事与此不同。
content.tw: 未來是個異國；那裡行事與此不同。

source: Hartley, L. P. The Go-Between. London: Hamish Hamilton, 1953.

content.en: The real is the impossible.
content.cn: 实在界即是不可能。
content.tw: 實在界即是不可能。

source: Lacan, Jacques. The Ethics of Psychoanalysis. New York: W. W. Norton & Company, 1992.

content.en: To love is to give what one does not have.
content.cn: 爱是给予你所没有的东西。
content.tw: 愛是給予你所沒有的東西。

source: Lacan, Jacques. Transference. Cambridge: Polity, 2015.

content.en: The object is always more important than the subject.
content.cn: 客体总是比主体更重要。
content.tw: 客體總是比主體更重要。

source: Harman, Graham. Object-Oriented Ontology: A New Theory of Everything. London: Pelican, 2018.

content.en: The dark is not the absence of light, but a presence of its own.
content.cn: 黑暗并非光的缺席，而是自身的在场。
content.tw: 黑暗並非光的缺席，而是自身的在場。

source: Morton, Timothy. Dark Ecology. New York: Columbia University Press, 2016.

content.en: We are all ghosts in the machine.
content.cn: 我们都是机器中的幽灵。
content.tw: 我們都是機器中的幽靈。

source: Ryle, Gilbert. The Concept of Mind. Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1949.

content.en: The self is a fiction.
content.cn: 自我是一个虚构。
content.tw: 自我是一個虛構。

source: Hume, David. A Treatise of Human Nature. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2000.

content.en: Reality is a hallucination that is shared.
content.cn: 现实是一种共享的幻觉。
content.tw: 現實是一種共享的幻覺。

source: Hoffman, Donald. The Case Against Reality. New York: W. W. Norton & Company, 2019.

content.en: The only truth is the lie.
content.cn: 唯一的真理即是谎言。
content.tw: 唯一的真理即是謊言。

source: Picasso, Pablo. Cited in Richardson, John. A Life of Picasso. New York: Random House, 1991.

content.en: We are the architects of our own destruction.
content.cn: 我们是自身毁灭的建筑师。
content.tw: 我們是自身毀滅的建築師。

source: Ballard, J. G. The Drowned World. London: Victor Gollancz, 1962.

content.en: The world is a stage, but the play is badly cast.
content.cn: 世界是一个舞台，但选角很烂。
content.tw: 世界是一個舞台，但選角很爛。

source: Wilde, Oscar. Lord Arthur Savile's Crime and Other Stories. London: Methuen & Co., 1891.

content.en: To see is to forget the name of the thing one sees.
content.cn: 观看即是遗忘所见之物的名字。
content.tw: 觀看即是遺忘所見之物的名字。

source: Valéry, Paul. Degas, Danse, Dessin. Paris: Gallimard, 1938.

content.en: The eye touches the distance.
content.cn: 眼睛触摸远方。
content.tw: 眼睛觸摸遠方。

source: Nancy, Jean-Luc. The Sense of the World. Minneapolis: University of Minnesota Press, 1997.

content.en: We are the dreams of the dead.
content.cn: 我们是死者的梦。
content.tw: 我們是死者的夢。

source: Borges, Jorge Luis. The Book of Sand. New York: Dutton, 1977.

content.en: The infinite is the negation of the finite.
content.cn: 无限即是对有限的否定。
content.tw: 無限即是對有限的否定。

source: Hegel, G. W. F. Science of Logic. London: Allen & Unwin, 1969.

content.en: Everything is a copy of a copy of a copy.
content.cn: 一切皆是副本的副本的副本。
content.tw: 一切皆是副本的副本的副本。

source: Palahniuk, Chuck. Fight Club. New York: W. W. Norton & Company, 1996.

content.en: The shadow is the unconscious of the object.
content.cn: 阴影是客体的无意识。
content.tw: 陰影是客體的無意識。

source: Stoichita, Victor I. A Short History of the Shadow. London: Reaktion Books, 1997.

content.en: Light is the first animal.
content.cn: 光是第一只动物。
content.tw: 光是第一隻動物。

source: Serres, Michel. The Parasite. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press, 1982.

content.en: The future is an opaque mirror.
content.cn: 未来是一面不透明的镜子。
content.tw: 未來是一面不透明的鏡子。

source: Irigaray, Luce. Speculum of the Other Woman. Ithaca: Cornell University Press, 1985.
